tips.tip:
You can execute current query using Ctrl+Enter shortcut.
Queries are separated by delimiters or empty lines.
You can select any part of SQL script and run it with Ctrl+Enter
You can run SQL script using Alt+X shortcut. Script queries are separated with delimiters (like ";" or "go").
You can filter table rows by column value (use F11 or Ctrl+F11) or by typing SQL expression in filter edit field
New version of DBeaver Community released once per two weeks (usually at Monday)

You can navigate over foreign keys in data view by pressing Ctrl+1 or using context menu.
Back/Forward buttons (Alt+Left/Right) near to the filter panel allow to jump to previous tables/filter values.
Ctrl+Shift+1 will open links in a new editor.
You can export data directly from SQL query without pre-executing it (use SQL editor context menu Execute->Export From Query).
You can assign your own shortcuts for almost any DBeaver operations. And you can change most of existing shortcuts.
You can debug PostgreSQL functions. Use debug tool (in the main toolbar) to initiate debug session.
Data editor supports copy/paste of multiple cells. USe Ctrl+Shift+V to paste multiple rows/columns (separated by tabs and line feeds)
DBeaver documentation can be found in our WIKI (https://github.com/dbeaver/dbeaver/wiki)
